alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Knox; Loudon; Monroe; Roane; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 12:54PM CDT until June 25 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Loudon County in east Tennessee... Southern Knox County in east Tennessee... South central Anderson County in east Tennessee... Blount County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Monroe County in east Tennessee... East central Roane County in east Tennessee... Southern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 153 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rockford to near Louisville to 8 miles south of Lenoir City, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Various reports of trees down across portions of Roane and west Knox counties. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Loudon, Gatlinburg, Farragut, Pigeon Forge and Louisville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 364 and 387. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 73 and 84. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Blount; Knox; Loudon; Monroe; Roane; Sevier
